Literature.Title: Cationic Intrinsically Disordered Antimicrobial Peptides (CIDAMPs) Represent a New Paradigm of Innate Defense with a Potential for Novel Anti-Infectives.
Literature.Author: Latendorf T, Gerstel U, Bartels J, Wu Z, Becker A, Tholey A, Schröder JM

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Human embryonic kidney HEK293 cells:50% Cytotoxicity=>32 µg/ml
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=16-32µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 700603(MIC=32µg/ml),Acinetobacter baumannii ATCC 19606(MIC=32µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=32µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 43300(MIC=4µg/ml),Candida albicans ATCC 90028(MIC=4µg/ml),Cryptococcus neoformans ATCC 208821(MIC=2µg/ml)
